Health and wellbeing picks for August 2015

Rubbernecker by Belinda Bauer

Featuring a character with Asperger’s syndrome, this darkly funny crime novel features a young man studying anatomy at university, seeking to uncover the mysterious death of his father.

The fault in our stars by John Green

Popular young adult book following Hazel, a teenage girl with terminal cancer. Her mum is concerned that her daughter is depressed, so she recommends Hazel to attend a support group. Hazel meets Augustus at the support group and her life takes an unexpected twist. You can also borrow the film from our catalogue.

Something for every page.
